choices.answer: a group of people that helped slaves escape
a train that took slaves to safe places
a tunnel where people bought slaves
the home where Harriet Tubman grew up

questions.question: What happened after Harriet Tubman escaped slavery?

choices.answer: she changed her name to Araminta Ross
she was sold into slavery
she was forced to work in the fields
she helped her family and others escape to the North

questions.question: Why did Harriet Tubman sometimes faint and fall into a deep sleep?

choices.answer: She was born with a disease that made her faint
She was tired all the time
She was scared
She had been hit in the head with an iron weight

questions.question: Who were the stationmasters on the Underground Railroad?

choices.answer: people who guided escaped slaves to safe places
people who hid escaped slaves in their homes
people who forced slaves to work in the fields
people who worked to allow women to vote

questions.question: What might have happened if Harriet Tubman had been caught?

choices.answer: She would have been given an award
She would have been punished
She would have been freed
She would have been sent to work on the Underground Railroad

questions.question: What was Harriet Tubman's role on the Underground Railroad?

choices.answer: conductor
overseer
stationmaster
safehouse

questions.question: How did Harriet Tubman help during the Civil War?

choices.answer: She worked as a driver, a writer, and a carpenter
She worked as a cook, a nurse, and a spy
She worked as a teacher, a painter, and a musician
She worked as a sailor, a writer, and a banker
Congress abolished slavery everywhere
The Civil War broke out
Harriet Tubman was born a slave
Harriet Tubman helped slaves escape to the North
